Problem:
Consider a linear differential equation system described by \\(\\dot{x} = Dx\\), where D is a diagonal matrix. We investigate the effect of a transformation defined by the operator \\( T(x) = P^{-1}e^{Qt}Px \\) over time t, where P and Q are constant matrices and \\( e^{Qt} \\) denotes the matrix exponential of Q.

If at a certain time \\( t_1 \\), a new function \\( S(x) = R^{-1}e^{St}Rx \\) (where R and S are constant matrices) is applied as an intervention, will the endpoint \\( x(T) \\) for T > t_1 depend only on D and not on Q or S?
Explanation: The new intervention \\( S(x) \\) introduces additional factors through matrices R, R^{-1}, and \\( e^{St} \\), affecting the final state \\( x(T) \\). Thus, the endpoint depends on Q, S, and D, reflecting the combined effects of all transformations.
